citations.narrative:
The current records of animals on hand are inaccurate. The licensee has purchased eleven dogs from another facility, but
has not listed that information on the required records of dogs on hand (form 7005). Additionally, five dogs have left the
facility but were not listed on the required disposition records (7006). This needs to be addressed and records maintained
in an accurate and timely manner.
Correct by: Oct 9, 2023

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily to have fecal waste removed. Several of the enclosures with shavings down
in the outdoor portion of the run have an accumulation of feces that needs to be removed. In addition, several of the
gravel areas for the larger runs also have feces that needs to be removed on a daily basis. This needs to be addressed
and fecal and food waste removed daily to reduce disease risks and potential contamination to the dogs.
Correct by: Oct 5, 2023

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Housekeeping at the facility needs to be addressed. There is a large black tub of shavings with a white grain bag left out
next to the left side of the kennel. The right side of the kennel has an outdoor run that is currently used to store
miscellaneous items such as old dog crates that are dirty, empty white grain bags, building materials, tables, and trash
containers. This area creates a breeding and living environment for pests and must be cleaned to reduce this clutter.
Lastly, there is discarded shavings and debris adjacent to the right side of the kennel that needs to be removed. This is
also an attractant to pests and should be removed to promote good housekeeping practices.
Correct by: Oct 10, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The current records of animals on hand are inaccurate. The licensee has purchased eleven dogs from another facility, but 
has not listed that information on the required records of dogs on hand (form 7005). Additionally, five dogs have left the 
facility but were not listed on the required disposition records (7006). This needs to be addressed and records maintained 
in an accurate and timely manner.  
Correct by: Oct 9, 2023 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily to have fecal waste removed. Several of the enclosures with shavings down 
in the outdoor portion of the run have an accumulation of feces that needs to be removed. In addition, several of the 
gravel areas for the larger runs also have feces that needs to be removed on a daily basis. This needs to be addressed 
and fecal and food waste removed  daily to reduce disease risks and potential contamination to the dogs. 
Correct by: Oct 5, 2023 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Housekeeping at the facility needs to be addressed. There is a large black tub of shavings with a white grain bag left out 
next to the left side of the kennel. The right side of the kennel has an outdoor run that is currently used to store 
miscellaneous items such as old dog crates that are dirty, empty white grain bags, building materials, tables, and trash 
containers. This area creates a breeding and living environment  for pests and must be cleaned to reduce this clutter. 
Lastly, there is discarded shavings and debris adjacent to the right side of the kennel that needs to be removed. This is 
also an attractant to pests and should be removed  to promote good housekeeping practices.  
Correct by: Oct 10, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
